chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert C Pettit was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Will have huber privilege.  DE will report to jail within two weeks. DE will have credit for good time.

The Court orders that if the defendant fails to pay the fine and costs within 60 days of the date of conviction or if the Court has authorized monthly payments for the fine and costs and they have not been paid, the Court will enter a judgment and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect this debt.  You must keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

records.addlTxt: Case settlement

Defendant Robert C Pettit in court with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement has been reached in this matter.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.    Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE will enter a plea on Ct's 2,4.  Ct's 1,3 will be DRI.  Court will accept and find the DE guilty.  Court will accept the recommendations of the parties.  Will order on Ct 2, sentence withheld, 1 year probation, comply with all DOC programming, CC, DNA sample/surcharge.  Ct 4-30 days jail with huber, CC, DNA surcharge.  Credit for 3 days.  Atty asks for 2 week before DE must report to jail.
